title: US seeks migrant workers to repay millions in lost wages
description: Some 13,000 Mexican migrant workers are owed $6.5 million in unpaid wages, according to a tweet from the United States Department of Labor's Bureau of International Labor Affairs, which announced a joint effort with Mexico to locate and compensate the workers.

title: Relations between the countries have routinely scraped bottom for decades. So what to make of the downing of a US Reaper drone over the Black Sea?
description: On Tuesday, a Russian Su-27 fighter forced down a US MQ-9 drone over the Black Sea.

title: Idaho is pushing to change its borders and absorb more than half of Oregon
description: Matt McCaw cringes if you say the word "secessionist" around him.

title: Violent clashes erupt in Naples ahead of Napoli's Champions League match against Frankfurt
description: Violent clashes erupted in the Italian city of Naples on Wednesday as ticketless German soccer fans descended on the city for a key Champions League match which they had been banned from attending.

title: A blob twice the width of the US is heading towards the Gulf of Mexico
description: CNN's Rosemary Church interviews a leading scientist about a massive seaweed blob twice the size of the US that's headed for the Gulf of Mexico.

title: Trump-aligned super PAC calls for Florida ethics investigation into DeSantis political activity
description: A super PAC closely aligned with former President Donald Trump is demanding Florida ethics investigators probe whether Gov. Ron DeSantis' recent political activity is violating state law.

title: Ke Huy Quan shares the career advice Cate Blanchett gave him on next steps post-Oscar
description: Newly crowned Oscar-winner Ke Huy Quan is thoroughly aware that success doesn't come easy, and is open to ideas on how to make his good fortune last.

title: Ohio man who falsely claimed to be Ghanaian prince sentenced to 20 years in prison
description: An Ohio man was sentenced to 20 years in prison Wednesday for pretending to be a Ghanaian prince and swindling more than a dozen victims out of hundreds of thousands of dollars.

title: Man builds 12-foot-tall snow tunnel to get out of home
description: A man tunneled out after up to 12 feet of snow enveloped his home near Lake Tahoe, California.

title: Federal and state investigators probe Santos' role in luxury yacht sale
description: Federal and state investigators are probing Republican Rep. George Santos' role in the sale of a $19 million yacht involving two of his wealthy donors, according to a law enforcement official.

title: Brazilian researchers find 'terrifying' plastic rocks on remote island
description: The geology of Brazil's volcanic Trindade Island has fascinated scientists for years, but the discovery of rocks made from plastic debris in this remote turtle refuge is sparking alarm.

title: The world's best airports for 2023, according to Skytrax
description: A light-filled, green haven that brands itself as a "destination in itself," Singapore's Changi Airport has reclaimed its spot at the top of Skytrax's annual ranking of the world's best airports.

title: Argentina heatwave has 'no similarities in history'
description: Argentina is grappling with an unprecedented late-summer heatwave as temperatures soar to record-breaking levels -- causing crops to wither, helping wildfires spread and adding huge pressure to a country already facing an economic crisis.

title: Stocks tumble as bank fears consume markets
Retired maj. general says Putin operating in 'gray zone' with downed US drone
description: Maj. Gen. James "Spider" Marks (Ret.) shares why he thinks Russian President Vladimir Putin directly requested a Russian fighter jet to take down a US drone over the Black Sea.

title: Chinese billionaire arrested and charged in alleged fraud conspiracy that bilked investors of more than $1 billion
description: Chinese billionaire and proclaimed dissident Guo Wengui was arrested Wednesday and charged with defrauding thousands of followers out of more than $1 billion through complex investment schemes, US prosecutors announced Wednesday.

title: Tofu or 'FU'? Personalized license plate sparks debate
description: Is this license plate naughty or nice? Depends on how you look at it. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Desperate Cyclone Freddy survivors dig with bare hands to search for survivors in rubble
description: Tropical Cyclone Freddy is losing strength after it ripped through southern Malawi, killing at least 225 people, but the resulting devastation has left survivors trapped and fighting for survival.

title: What to know about spat between US and Russia
description: The Russian downing of a US drone over the Black Sea on Tuesday has prompted a diplomatic spat and a race to recover some highly classified technology.

title: Unlike the US, Europe kept its banks on a tight rein post-2008. That was smart
description: Shares in European banks slumped Wednesday as speculation about the health of Credit Suisse reignited the market turmoil sparked by the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank.

title: Anti-Black racism surfaces in an African country. Critics are blaming the president for it
description: A viral video from late February showed a man decrying the incompatibility of Black African "values" with those of Tunisians. Asked by the interviewer if he had ever met any Africans, he retorted implying he knows them well "because my grandfather used to buy and sell them."

title: How safe is the abortion pill compared with other common drugs
description: A federal judge in Texas holds a hearing Wednesday morning in a lawsuit seeking to block access to mifepristone nationwide, the first drug in the medication abortion process.

title: Iga Swiatek: World No.1 calls for more support for Ukrainian tennis players
description: World No.1 Iga Świątek has called for more support for Ukrainian players from the Women's Tennis Association (WTA), adding that "everything we discuss in tennis is about Belarusian and Russian players."

title: NASA and Axiom unveil spacesuits astronauts will wear on the moon
description: NASA and Texas-based company Axiom Space have revealed a new spacesuit design — and it could be these very suits that are eventually worn by the first woman and person of color to walk on the moon.

title: EPA finalizes rule to cut down on harmful smog and pollution from power plants
description: The Environmental Protection Agency announced Wednesday it had finalized its so-called good-neighbor rule, which aims to cut down on harmful smog and nitrogen oxide pollution from coal-fired power plants and industrial facilities.

title: Why no one wants to call this a 'bailout'
Fugitive search underway for ex-Hogan chief of staff who allegedly stole $276,000
description: An interstate investigation is underway for a one-time chief of staff to former Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan after he failed to appear in court on Monday, the US Marshals Service said.

title: Kremlin: Russia-US relations at 'lowest point' after drone incident
Diplo opens up about his sexuality, says he's a 'vibe guy'
description: Diplo is talking about his love life.

title: Austin slams Russian downing of drone as 'aggressive'
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin vowed on Wednesday that US aircraft will continue to "fly and to operate wherever international law allows," one day after Russian aircraft hit a US drone over the Black Sea, forcing it to be brought down in international waters.

title: Russian hackers targeted European military and transport organizations in newly discovered spying campaign
description: Russian military-linked hackers used a critical flaw in Microsoft's email software to target -- and in some cases infiltrate -- the networks of European military, energy and transportation organizations in an apparent spying campaign that went undetected for months as the war in Ukraine raged, Microsoft told its customers in a report obtained by CNN.

title: Dow falls 500 points as banking fears spread
description: The Dow opened the day with a decline of more than 500 points Wednesday as banking fears spread across global markets.

title: Spain's Crown Princess Leonor to start three-year military training
description: Spain's Crown Princess Leonor, the heir presumptive to the throne, will start three years of military training later this year in preparation for her future role as head of state, Spanish Defense Minister Margarita Robles confirmed at a press conference on Wednesday.

title: Drone forced down over Black Sea may never be recovered, spokesperson for National Security Council says
The dinosaur with the longest neck identified by paleontologists
description: A plant-eating sauropod that lumbered around what's now China some 162 million years ago had a neck that was about 10 feet longer than a typical school bus — and the longest of any known dinosaur.

title: Environmental groups file two lawsuits hoping to stop the Willow Project, citing climate impacts
description: Environmental and indigenous groups have filed two separate lawsuits challenging the Willow Project on Alaska's North Slope after the Biden administration approved the oil drilling venture on Monday.

title: Pilot makes first-ever plane landing on Burj Al Arab helipad
description: Polish pilot Lukasz Czepiela made aviation history on Tuesday, becoming the first person to land a plane on the helipad of the iconic Burj Al Arab Jumeirah hotel in Dubai.

title: Long before ChatGPT, these online chat bots were already talking to humans
description: ChatGPT's ability to sound human might feel new, but more than 20 years ago internet pioneers were already chatting with bots recruited by websites. Explore CNN's early reporting about bots replacing humans online.

title: Your snoring could be a sign of something more dangerous
description: You've heard of sleep apnea, but what is it exactly? Weill Cornell sleep specialist Dr. Daniel Barone explains what it looks like and how it affects your long-term health

title: Bali plans to ban tourists from renting motorbikes
description: Indonesia's "island of the gods" plans to enact some rules that may make it feel a bit less heavenly for foreign travelers.

title: See lawmaker's viral breakdown of SVB collapse
description: Rep. Jeff Jackson (D-NC) went viral on TikTok for explaining what he learned during an emergency congressional briefing with Treasury officials following the Silicon Valley Bank collapse.

title: What metaverse? Meta says its single largest investment is now in 'advancing AI'
description: Roughly a year-and-a-half after Facebook renamed itself "Meta" and said it would go all-in on building a future version of the internet dubbed the metaverse, the tech giant now says its top investment priority will be advancing artificial intelligence.

title: 'There it goes': California man watches helplessly as tree falls on neighbor's house
description: This is the eleventh atmospheric river to inundate California this winter season, arriving on the heels of another storm that hit central California particularly hard. The combination of strong winds and heavy rain also left over 206,000 homes and businesses without power. About 30 million people remain under flood alert.

title: Mike Krzyzewski: Legendary Duke coach on the secrets of his success and importance of his family name
description: Having retired as all-time winningest coach in men's Division I college basketball and guided the US men's team to three Olympic gold medals, it's safe to say that Mike Krzyzewski knows a thing or two about success.

title: Credit Suisse shares crash as Saudi investor rules out more funds
description: Shares of Credit Suisse crashed more than 20% to a record low after its biggest shareholder appeared to rule out providing any more funding for the embattled Swiss lender.

title: The forgotten rescue plan that could prevent another SVB-like collapse
description: After Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank failed, the US government stepped in with an extraordinary measure to rescue customers, some of whom held many millions of dollars in uninsured deposits that otherwise would have been wiped out.

title: The last UK budget nearly crashed the economy. It's still stuck in the doldrums
Ivan Toney: Soccer fan banned from every UK stadium for three years for racially abusing Premier League star
description: A soccer fan who racially abused Brentford FC star Ivan Toney on social media has been banned from every UK stadium for three years, the Premier League club announced in a statement on Tuesday.

title: What we know about the Alabama basketball player scandal as their tournament kicks off
description: The Alabama Crimson Tide will begin their March Madness journey on Thursday when they face the Texas A&M-Corpus Christi Islanders in the opening round.

title: British and German fighter jets intercept Russian aircraft near Estonian airspace
The last UK budget nearly crashed the economy. It's still stuck in the doldrums
description: The last time a British finance minister unveiled a "budget for growth," UK financial markets crashed and mortgage rates shot up, threatening to tip an already weak economy into a deep recession. Kwasi Kwarteng was out of office within weeks, to be followed shortly by his boss, former Prime Minister Liz Truss.

title: Did bailing out SVB's customers set a bad precedent?
description: Lori Bettinger, president of BancAlliance and former director of the TARP Capital Purchase Program, tells "Nightcap's" Jon Sarlin the government's actions to guarantee deposits at SVB and Signature Bank does not create "moral hazard" by incentivizing risky behavior.

title: 'Am I dreaming?': Double lung transplants save two people with late-stage cancer
description: Two people with stage IV lung cancer who had been told that they had only weeks or months to live are breathing freely after receiving double lung transplants, Northwestern Medicine in Chicago said Wednesday.

title: Look of the Week: Hunter Schafer's ethereal Oscars after-party look
description: The three words that best describe Hunter Schafer's Vanity Fair Oscars party look? Less is more.

title: China has shattered the assumption of US dominance in the Middle East
Russian jet dumped fuel on US drone over Black Sea, then hit its propeller
'My super strength is scoring goals,' says soccer star after record-breaking evening
description: Erling Haaland turned in another record-breaking performance as he scored five goals in Manchester City's emphatic victory over RB Leipzig in the Champions League.

title: Hi-res art scans from famous Taiwan museum leak online... and turn up for sale on Chinese online shopping platform
description: A Taiwanese museum that houses some of the world's most precious Chinese artworks has confirmed that up to 100,000 high-resolution images of paintings and calligraphy leaked online -- some of them turning up for sale on a Chinese shopping platform for less than $1.

title: Brian May, lead guitarist of Queen, receives knighthood from King Charles III
description: Legendary rock guitarist Brian May has received a knighthood from Britain's King Charles III.

title: A Japanese YouTube star became a lawmaker last year. Now he's been fired for never coming to work
description: A YouTube star who became a Japanese lawmaker has been stripped of his role after he failed to show up for a single day of work in parliament.

title: Free-diver plunges to record depth beneath frozen Swiss lake
description: David Vencl emerged from the depths of Switzerland's Lake Sils on Tuesday after a record dive beneath the ice to a depth of more than 50 meters (164 feet) without a wetsuit.

title: First equality, then respect: Nelly Korda believes new-mixed team event is the 'perfect' next step to grow women's golf
description: When Nelly Korda faced off against two of the PGA Tour's finest in December, she received rave reviews.

title: 'Plenty of bodies in the mud': Man points out where bodies lie after deadly cyclone
description: A deadly cyclone has broken records for the longest-lasting storm of its kind after making landfall in southern Africa for a second time, more than two weeks after the first. CNN's Larry Madowo reports.

title: African basketball stars are making their mark on the NBA
description: March 11 marked the start of the Basketball Africa League, the continent's premier basketball competition. Ahead of its third season, president Amadou Gallo Fall reflected on the rise of the sport on the continent. "It's been an evolutive journey," he said.

title: Elderly penguins receive 'world first' custom lenses in successful cataract surgery
description: Three elderly king penguins have been fitted with custom-made eye lenses during surgery to remove cataracts in what is believed to be a world first procedure to improve their sight, according to a Singapore zoo.

title: Polish court convicts rights activist for supplying pregnant woman with abortion pills
description: Human rights groups have condemned the conviction of a Polish activist for supplying a pregnant woman with abortion pills in a landmark trial under the country's ultra-strict abortion laws.

title: A blob twice the width of the US is heading towards Florida's coast
description: CNN's Rosemary Church interviews a leading scientist about a 5,000-mile-wide stinky seaweed blob that's headed for Florida beaches in the coming months.

title: Myanmar monastery attack kills 22 as conflicting accounts emerge of alleged massacre
description: At least 22 people, including three monks, were killed at a monastery in Myanmar's Southern Shan State on Saturday as local insurgent groups and the military accused each other of carrying out a massacre.

title: Russia doesn't want confrontation with US, envoy says
Russia does not want confrontation with US, Russian ambassador says
China has shattered assumption of US dominance  Middle East
description: With a grandiose diplomatic flourish China brokered a rapprochement between Saudi Arabia and Iran, in the process upending US calculus in the Gulf and beyond.

title: Vinícius Jr. is being racially abused during La Liga matches. Why is nobody being punished?
description: Vinícius Jr scored the goal that secured Real Madrid's 14th European Cup last May, and this season his brilliance has continued to light up the team's Champions League campaign.

title: Go inside the Harry Potter Studio Tour in Tokyo
description: Warner Bros. will soon open its Harry Potter Studio Tour in Tokyo. The immersive experience will allow fans to experience the movies' iconic sets, props and effects. CNN's Marc Stewart goes behind the scenes. Warner Bros. Discovery is the parent company of CNN.

title: Analysis: The two biggest 2024 Republican names would mean bad news for Ukraine
description: Russia might be bogged down in its vicious onslaught on Ukraine, but President Vladimir Putin is winning big elsewhere -- in the Republican presidential primary.

title: Taiwan unveils its new combat and surveillance drones as China threat grows
Not just casinos: Macao reimagines tourism post-pandemic
description: Like many of his peers, Dan McAulay was furloughed from his job as a pilot during the pandemic.

title: 'Harry Potter' tour heads to Tokyo as Warner Bros courts more Asia fans
description: Hogwarts is coming to Tokyo, as Warner Bros. pushes to expand one of the most successful franchises in literary and cinematic history.

title: Xi tightens grip on Chinese Communist Party, takes aim at US
See impact of missile striking residential area in Ukraine
description: CNN senior international correspondent Ivan Watson walks through Kramatorsk, Ukraine, where residents deal with the aftermath of a strike by Russian forces.

title: Ukrainian sniper on killing Russians: 'Can't think...you just act'
description: CNN's Erin Burnett speaks with Ukrainian soldier Roman Trokhymets about his experience fighting against Russians near Bakhmut.

title: Why Israelis are protesting government's push to weaken Supreme Court
description: Despite weeks of protests, the Israeli Parliament, the Knesset, pushed two key elements of the sweeping judicial reform bill that limit the Israeli Supreme Court's power. CNN's Richard Quest reports.

title: Watch Colombian Navy remove 3 tons of cocaine from drug smuggling ship
description: The Colombian Navy intercepted a semi-submersible ship containing two dead people and nearly 3 tons of cocaine in the Pacific Ocean.
